title: Los Angeles Education
text: The map illustrates the spatial distribution of educational attainment across census tracts in Los Angeles County, specifically focusing on the percentage of adults with a bachelor’s degree or higher. Areas with higher concentrations of college-educated residents—such as Santa Monica, Pasadena, and coastal neighborhoods—appear in warmer colors like yellow and orange, indicating rates above 60%. In contrast, darker purple regions in the northern interior and parts of South and Southeast Los Angeles represent neighborhoods where fewer than 20% of adults hold a bachelor’s degree. The stark geographic disparities highlighted in the map reflect broader socioeconomic divides within the county, suggesting that access to higher education remains unevenly distributed. This visualization provides a powerful tool for identifying communities that may benefit from targeted educational resources or policy interventions.

title: About
text:
Cao, I am Faisal Jan from Turbat (Obviously, a very hot city). I made this project during Kane’s Data Science Bootcamp and took a lot of help from AI.
You can see my work on GitHub or we can always connect on LinkedIn. Grazie!
